org.apache.spark.util

Class AsynchronousListenerBus<L,E>

  • Object
    • org.apache.spark.util.AsynchronousListenerBus<L,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logging, ListenerBus<L,E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LiveListenerBus, StreamingListenerBus

    public abstract class AsynchronousListenerBus<L,E>
extends Object
implements ListenerBus<L,E>
    Asynchronously passes events to registered listeners.

    Until start() is called, all posted events are only buffered. Only after this listener bus has started will events be actually propagated to all attached listeners. This listener bus is stopped when stop() is called, and it will drop further events after stopping.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsynchronousListenerBus

        public AsynchronousListenerBus(String name)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(SparkContext sc)
        Start sending events to attached listeners.

        This first sends out all buffered events posted before this listener bus has started, then listens for any additional events asynchronously while the listener bus is still running. This should only be called once.

        Parameters:
        sc - Used to stop the SparkContext in case the listener thread dies.

      • post

        public void post(E event)

      • waitUntilEmpty

        public boolean waitUntilEmpty(int timeoutMillis)
        For testing only. Wait until there are no more events in the queue, or until the specified time has elapsed. Return true if the queue has emptied and false is the specified time elapsed before the queue emptied.

      • listenerThreadIsAlive

        public boolean listenerThreadIsAlive()
        For testing only. Return whether the listener daemon thread is still alive.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the listener bus. It will wait until the queued events have been processed, but drop the new events after stopping.

      • onDropEvent

        public abstract void onDropEvent(E event)
        If the event queue exceeds its capacity, the new events will be dropped. The subclasses will be notified with the dropped events.

        Note: onDropEvent can be called in any thread.
